<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.02

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Multiplayer

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Return a UniqueID of the given unit (player).

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>important</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Up until [[<template><title>arma2oa</title></template>]] v1.60, the result always consisted of a [[str|stringified]] number (see [[getPlayerUIDOld]]), but always had to be considered and processed as a [[String]].<comment><!--
--></comment> Converting it to a [[Number]] could cause precision problems, as [[Number]] cannot accurately represent integers above 16777216 (2<sup>24</sup>).<comment><!--
--></comment> Moreover, games since [[<template><title>arma2oa</title></template>]] v1.61 provide a value that is not all-numeric.</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>The returned string is the player's steamID64:
<code>[[private]] _steamProfileUrl <template><title>=</title></template> "http://<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>steamcommunity.com/profiles/" + ([[getPlayerUID]] [[player]]);</code></value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>pr</name>=<value> In some cases, the identity of certain player units might fail to propagate to other clients and the server,
which causes [[isPlayer]] and [[getPlayerUID]] to incorrectly return <tt>[[false]]</tt> and <tt>""</tt> respectively,
where the affected units are [[not]] [[local]] - see [https://github.com/michail-nikolaev/task-force-arma-3-radio/issues/1096 this bug report (GitHub)].
Therefore, beware of false negatives.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[getPlayerUID]] unit

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] "_SP_AI_" or "_SP_PLAYER_" in SP, "" or UID in MP.<br>
The unique ID may be up to 100 characters long and may contain numbers, uppercase letters and underscores.<br>
The value can be used to construct a valid variable name by appending to another valid variable name,<br>
e.g <template><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[[missionNamespace]] [[setVariable]] ["TAG_player" + _uid, _unit];</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _uid = [[getPlayerUID]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[BIS_fnc_getUnitByUID]], [[getPlayerUIDOld]], [[getClientState]], [[getClientStateNumber]]
</value></part></template>
